intro: Uragoga melanotricha, commonly known as the black-haired uragoga, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking dark green leaves with a velvety texture and its clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in tropical rainforests. Its distinctive black hairy stems and foliage make it easily identifiable. Due to habitat loss, Uragoga melanotricha is considered endangered, prompting conservation efforts to protect its natural habitat.
